nodes.bodyText:
This is all pretty off base I think.
First of all, we do not recommend overriding the jnlp container except under unusual circumstances. You pretty much always just use the default one. For actual build steps, you use separate containers, which can be anything, and the container step.
Second, it is generally discouraged to even use the global pod template configuration. Better to use the podTemplate step and define your requirements directly inside the job—or via some library etc.
The existing samples, for example in #707, show these things in action. No global configuration or custom images are required.
